content: It's my job to be next to people with the 'Rona and not once have I gotten an alert.

As part of my work I am considered a Essential worker and I have never once received a Alert or Notification from the application that I have be exposed to convid ! Even though 2 of my coworkers tested Positive! I have self quarantined Twice, This Application is Useless! The Cares Act included Money for Public Health Notification and Awareness!! Please Fix this ASAP Hire a application developer to Turn this Application into a Real Tool !!! Shame on The State of CT Gov!!
What code do I have to enter? I was never given one.
This App does nothing, I have been in contact with several people who had tested positive for COVID and this app did not alert me to anything.

Deficiencies with this app. A. Not everyone in Ct. has this installed on their cell phone. B. Not everyone that tests positive is reporting it. There's been 2 ppl at work that recently tested positive and this app never alerted me.
None of these apps work together. People should not have to worry if they have the correct states app installed and active, then have to switch between apps depending on what state they are in.
I work in a residential facility where both staff and residents have cell phones. Not once, with any positive case, has this app notified me of an exposure. Very disappointing.
Totally pointless. Unless everyone else is using theres no point in having it. My wife and I have been around several people who have been covid positive and never received a warning.
Just saw

Why ONLY allow the fingerprint scan option and not offer the password/pin option? (Meanning I cannot access the scanned list). Is it that challenging for the devs to realize we all don't utilize/have access to the SAME FEATURES. This app is the equivalent of a paperweight, in my phone.
Was exposed and received no notification
I never recieved an alert even though I have it set up to alert me. It did notify inside the app but I would have never known if I hadn't looked.
Idk what to do with the app

I have never received a warning no I'm not sure if the app works or not. I have been diagnosed with Covid-19. I went to put it on the app. And it asks for a code. What code. I got a test result not a code for a gift card. And no explanation on the app as to where I find or get a code. Maybe this is why I haven't received any warnings. Should have known something from the CT government would not work well
replyContent: We are sorry you have been tested positive. The code required to alert your contacts (people you have a been within 6 feet for 15 Min) is generated by the CT Contact Tracing team. They will be able to step you through that process of releasing the key to help protect your friends. **SMcC DPH admin**

content: I'm not sure how to rate this app (see the XKCD comic on tornado warnings). I'm mostly reviewing to point out a SERIOUS flaw in the design of this app. I live on the border w/ NY. NY has it's own identical app. I can not run both apps at the same time. So I have to pick between CT or NY. What is the reason for this and why is this administered by the states at all? Why isn't there a national app?
They should have a nation wide one not state by state
Someone in my building tested positive but I got no alert.
Good.
The exposure notification activation issue I reported in November seems to be resolved. Thanks!
replyContent: Kenneth - We are actively working on resolving an issue identified with some Samsung phones. Thank you for participating. Please check back occasionally for an updated version. **SMcC DPH App Admin **

content: It was slowing my phone down
I love it
Im not going to test this app.
Is this app just for CT? Does it work in Maine? I've had it for a month and no notifications as cases are spiking here.
replyContent: This App will work in Maine, or any other state that uses the ENx system, And will record when you are close to other Phones with the app in Maine. But it is the CT Department of Public Heath that generates the release "keys" s it is only possible to release the notifications for tests on residents of CT. **SMcC DPH admin**

content: I was exposed to the virus and this app never warned me. To me this app sucks
replyContent: This app will record when you are close to people who also have the app. when they enter their release keys. you will be notified. If they don't have the app, or don't do their part and enter the release key, the you won't be notified. We hope you were not infected !! **SMcC DPH admin**

hews

Not working
Goodapp

I'm glad the State is doing this, but being near someone's app isn't enough. Not everyone has the app. Why aren't we informed of cases in our town? No personal information needed. I know someone who is positive, and that would be good to know how many, if any cases are in my town w/o having to go to DPH.
The best thing that ever came out

App does not work! I go to turn on exposure notifications and I get the error "something went wrong" and no way to contact Devs of how to fix this. I wanted to specifically use this while out tomorrow.
Great

After deep diving the privacy claims of this app, I feel given it's a fully voluntary system that if you're concerned about covid-19 infection/spread, this app is a useful tool to protect yourself/loved ones while also contributing to the greater good by stopping the spread. Unlike other w reviews, I have had no noticable battery issues B-LE feature on my Note 9. Lost 1 star for some UX bugs I'm sure will be resolved soon.
replyContent: Nick - You are correct this does not collect any personal information through the app and is uses the low power Bluetooth. Thank you for your support. ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: I live in Taunton, MA & don't travel much. Is it OK to use this until Massachusetts releases one if at all? If it's useless unless I am in or near CT please let me know and I'll uninstall it.
replyContent: Bobby - This App will still work to tell you who you are close to, and be notified if someone else you are around from CT tests positive, but if YOU test positive the key can only be triggered by the CT Department of Public Health. As as a Mass resident we would not know your notification key. Thank you for your support. ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: Impressive. I am impressed at the effort expended by the State of CT to ensure the safety of its residents, creating an app to track and notify exposure to the threat of a virus that kills approximately 1% of the population (not counting the elderly and those co-morbid), and at the same time continue with the virus-turned-political-weapon that is the COVID19/WUHAN virus. I recall an era when individuals whom presented a threat to the health of others were the ones quarantined. Ugh.
replyContent: Thank you for downloading and supporting this App. Our hope is that wide spread use of this technology in CT will help others stay safe when people they are around, have been tested positive. Thank you for your support. ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: Dont know if it work...
replyContent: Jose - This app is configured so that it stores a record if your are within 6 ft. of another installed app for 15 minutes. It retains your list for 14 days. During that time, if anyone on your list is tested positive then you will be alerted. Hopefully this will stay quiet for you !! Thank you for doing your part ! ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: I just downloaded the app I hope I like it and it helps to keep us safe or lets us know how to better besides disinfectant spray
replyContent: Jill - Thank you for helping and doing your part ! ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: Contact tracing is a joke..... My kids have had covid for over a week and a half now, no one has called... I've had it for a week now and no one has called. And u can't report it to the app without be contacted, so someone infected is going around infecting other and not knowing it. Great job CT!
replyContent: Matt - we are very sorry you are ill. Thank you for downloading and supporting this App. Our hope is that wide spread use of this technology will help others know when people they are around, have been tested positive. Thank you for your support. We all hope you get better soon ! ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: Great
replyContent: Bear - Thank you for your support ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: All citizens must be alert about covid-19.Most of the citizens are not wearing Masks, not maintaining social distance. Due to these reasons Covid-19 is not reducing among people. This app is very useful to control covid-19 ,because it alerts the peron who d uses this app-- Ramana VTV.
replyContent: Ramana - This app is configured to help you be aware ! It stores a record if your are within 6 ft. of another installed app for 15 minutes. If anyone on your list is tested positive then you will be alerted. Hopefully this will stay quiet for you !! Thank you for doing your part ! ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: Nice app, like others have said i appreciate that it doesnt require permissions and the privacy model is transparent. Only thing that could make it better is if it was open source.
replyContent: Sam - Thank you for your support! Unfortunately we can not make it open source. . . But we have made it FREE! Both the Google and Microsoft ENx Teams are actively involved in regular integration changes and updating of this. ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: Great app. Glad to see CT dept of health participating in this notification system. Be a patriot and wear a mask. It will save lives and prevent the need for further lock downs. No permissions needed. You have no excuse unless you hate your country.
replyContent: David - Thank you for your support! ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: I hope this updates with past exposures/past positive testers too since I just installed it & it's only providing new reports, of which it's currently empty. Also hope the Samsung Secure Folder installation glitch will be fixed soon.
replyContent: Aurelia - thanks for installing this. Unfortunately this only works from the time you install itha app and activate it forward. We have no way of determining who was within 6 feet of you for 15 minutes, before you activated the app. Thank you for your support ** SMcC DPH Admin **

This app is a hoax 😉 Update: I forgot that I wrote the above "review" until I got a response from the developer. I just want to say thank you for everything you are doing. This app is a great idea. Keep up the good work! I probably should have kept my original tongue in cheek "review" to myself.
replyContent: John - Most scientific evidence does not come to the same conclusion. Thank you for your support ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: Bluetooth and location are always on. Significant battery drain. When a covid notification pops up, it does not take you to view that information. Rather you have to download the active app or you just get a spinning wheel.
replyContent: Robert - Yes you are correct. This app is configured so that it records if your are within 6 ft. of another installed app for 15 minutes. To do this it requires Bluetooth on but it remains in the "low power mode". Most users have reported negligible battery drain from this setting. ** SMcC DPH Admin **

content: It ONLY tells if the Bluetooth is ON ? Right... if the person tested positive and the Bluetooth is off dosen't work?
replyContent: Fitim _ Thank you. You are correct Bluetooth must remain on, but it uses the "low power" setting (it only needs a 6 foot radius) which is minimal power. Most people report no observable battery drain. **SMcC DPH App Admin **

I researched how this app works and I'm very comfortable with the way it protects privacy. I am curious though, if I'm around someone from another state that has their state's app and they get covid, will I get notified?
replyContent: Eric - Yes, this is completely anonymous. It is all being coordinated though the APHL servers so If their App has you listed as being with in the proximity threshold (as defined by that state DPH), you will be notified when the positive test is reported in that state. **SMcC DPH App Admin **
